str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: To unveil, uncover. From ana and kalupto; to unveil.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To transform, transfigure. From meta and morphoo; to transform.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
An image, likeness, bust. From eiko; a likeness, i.e. statue, profile, or representation, resemblance.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Even as, just as. From katha and per; exactly as.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
